member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidStartScreenRecordingOptions.WithBitRate(System.Int32)
member.summary: The video bit rate for the video, in megabits per second. The default value is 4000000 (4 Mb/s) for Android API level below 27 and 20000000 (20 Mb/s) for API level 27 and above. You can increase the bit rate to improve video quality, but doing so results in larger movie files.
member.param: The actual bit rate (Mb/s).
member.returns: self instance for chaining.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidStartScreenRecordingOptions.WithVideoSize(System.String)
member.summary: The video size of the generated media file. The format is WIDTHxHEIGHT. The default value is the device's native display resolution (if supported), 1280x720 if not. For best results, use a size supported by your device's Advanced Video Coding (AVC) encoder.
member.param: The actual video size: WIDTHxHEIGHT.
member.returns: self instance for chaining.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidStartScreenRecordingOptions.EnableBugReport
member.summary: Makes the recorder to display an additional information on the video overlay, such as a timestamp, that is helpful in videos captured to illustrate bugs. This option is only supported since API level 27 (Android P).
member.returns: self instance for chaining.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidStartScreenRecordingOptions.WithTimeLimit(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
The maximum recording time.The default and maximum value is 180 seconds (3 minutes). Setting values greater than this or less than zero will cause an exception. The minimum time resolution unit is one second.
Since Appium 1.8.2 the time limit can be up to 1800 seconds (30 minutes). Appium will automatically try to merge the 3-minutes chunks recorded by the screenrecord utility, however, this requires FFMPEG utility to be installed and available in PATH on the server machine. If the utility is not present then the most recent screen recording chunk is going to be returned as the result.
member.param: The actual time limit of the recorded video.
member.returns: self instance for chaining.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.ActionDown
member.summary: getAction() value: the key has been pressed down. (0x00000000)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.ActionMultiple
member.summary: getAction() value: multiple duplicate key events have occurred in a row, or a complex string is being delivered. If the key code is not {#link Keycode_UNKNOWN then the {#link getRepeatCount() method returns the number of times the given key code should be executed. Otherwise, if the key code is Keycode_UNKNOWN, then this is a sequence of characters as returned by getCharacters(). (0x00000002)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.ActionUp
member.summary: getAction() value: the key has been released. (0x00000001)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagCanceled
member.summary: When associated with up key events, this indicates that the key press has been canceled. Typically this is used with virtual touch screen keys, where the user can slide from the virtual key area on to the display: in that case, the application will receive a canceled up event and should not perform the action normally associated with the key. Note that for this to work, the application can not perform an action for a key until it receives an up or the long press timeout has expired. (0x00000020)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagCanceledLongPress
member.summary: Set when a key event has FLAG_CANCELED set because a long press action was executed while it was down. (0x00000100)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagEditorAction
member.summary: This mask is used for compatibility, to identify enter keys that are coming from an IME whose enter key has been auto-labelled "next" or "done". This allows TextView to dispatch these as normal enter keys for old applications, but still do the appropriate action when receiving them. (0x00000010)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagFallback
member.summary: Set when a key event has been synthesized to implement default behavior for an event that the application did not handle. Fallback key events are generated by unhandled trackball motions (to emulate a directional keypad) and by certain unhandled key presses that are declared in the key map (such as special function numeric keypad keys when numlock is off). (0x00000400)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagFromSystem
member.summary: This mask is set if an event was known to come from a trusted part of the system. That is, the event is known to come from the user, and could not have been spoofed by a third party component. (0x00000008)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagKeepTouchMode
member.summary: This mask is set if we don't want the key event to cause us to leave touch mode. (0x00000004)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagLongPress
member.summary: This flag is set for the first key repeat that occurs after the long press timeout. (0x00000080)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagSoftKeyboard
member.summary: This mask is set if the key event was generated by a software keyboard. (0x00000002)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagTracking
member.summary: Set for ACTION_UP when this event's key code is still being tracked from its initial down. That is, somebody requested that tracking started on the key down and a long press has not caused the tracking to be canceled. (0x00000200)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagVirtualHardKey
member.summary: This key event was generated by a virtual (on-screen) hard key area. Typically this is an area of the touchscreen, outside of the regular display, dedicated to "hardware" buttons. (0x00000040)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.AndroidKeyCode.FlagWokeHere
member.summary: This constant was deprecated in API level 20. This flag will never be set by the system since the system consumes all wake keys itself. This mask is set if the device woke because of this key event. (0x00000001)

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiScrollable.FlingBackward
member.summary: Performs a backwards fling action with the default number of fling steps (5). If the swipe direction is set to vertical, then the swipe will be performed from top to bottom. If the swipe direction is set to horizontal, then the swipes will be performed from left to right. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew. Maps to the UiScrollable.flingBackward() method.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiScrollable.FlingForward
member.summary: Performs a forward fling with the default number of fling steps (5). If the swipe direction is set to vertical, then the swipes will be performed from bottom to top. If the swipe direction is set to horizontal, then the swipes will be performed from right to left. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew. Maps to the UiScrollable.flingForward() method.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiScrollable.FlingToBeginning(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a fling gesture to reach the beginning of a scrollable layout element. The beginning can be at the top-most edge in the case of vertical controls, or the left-most edge for horizontal controls. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew. Maps to the UiScrollable.flingToBeginning(int) method.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiScrollable.FlingToEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a fling gesture to reach the end of a scrollable layout element. The end can be at the bottom-most edge in the case of vertical controls, or the right-most edge for horizontal controls. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew. Maps to the UiScrollable.flingToEnd() method.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiScrollable.GetChildByDescription(OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiSelector,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for a child element in the present scrollable container. The search first looks for a child element that matches the selector you provided, then looks for the content-description in its children elements. If both search conditions are fulfilled, the method returns a {@ link UiObject} representing the element matching the selector (not the child element in its subhierarchy containing the content-description). By default, this method performs a scroll search. Maps to the UiScrollable.getChildByDescription(UiSelector, String, boolean) method.
member.param: UiSelector for a child in a scollable layout element
Content-description to find in the children of the childPattern match (may be a partial match)
Set to true if scrolling is allowed

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiScrollable.GetChildByInstance(OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiSelector,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches for a child element in the present scrollable container that matches the selector you provided. The search is performed without scrolling and only on visible elements. Maps to the UiScrollable.getChildByInstance(UiSelector, int) method.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiScrollable.GetChildByText(OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiSelector,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for a child element in the present scrollable container. The search first looks for a child element that matches the selector you provided, then looks for the text in its children elements. If both search conditions are fulfilled, the method returns a {@ link UiObject} representing the element matching the selector (not the child element in its subhierarchy containing the text). By default, this method performs a scroll search. Maps to the UiScrollable.getChildByText(UiSelector, String, boolean) method.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiScrollable.ScrollBackward(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a backward scroll. If the swipe direction is set to vertical, then the swipes will be performed from top to bottom. If the swipe direction is set to horizontal, then the swipes will be performed from left to right. Make sure to take into account devices configured with right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew. Maps to the UiScrollable.scrollBackward(int) method.
member.param: Number of steps. Use this to control the speed of the scroll action.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Android.UiAutomator.AndroidUiScrollable.SetSwipeDeadZonePercentage(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the percentage of a widget's size that's considered as no-touch zone when swiping. The no-touch zone is set as percentage of a widget's total width or height, denoting a margin around the swipable area of the widget. Swipes must always start and end inside this margin. This is important when the widget being swiped may not respond to the swipe if started at a point too near to the edge. The default is 10% from either edge. Maps to the UiScrollable.setSwipeDeadZonePercentage(double) method.
member.param: A percentage value from 0 to 1

member.summary: Amount of time to wait for Webview context to become active, in ms. Defaults to 2000

member.summary: Intent action which will be used to start activity (default android.intent.action.MAIN)

member.summary: Intent category which will be used to start activity (default android.intent.category.LAUNCHER)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.IntentFlags
member.summary: Flags that will be used to start activity (default 0x10200000)

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.OptionalIntentArguments
member.summary: Additional intent arguments that will be used to start activity. See Intent arguments: http://developer.android.com/tools/help/adb.html#IntentSpec

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.DontStopAppOnReset
member.summary: Doesn't stop the process of the app under test, before starting the app using adb. If the app under test is created by another anchor app, setting this false, allows the process of the anchor app to be still alive, during the start of the test app using adb. In other words, with dontStopAppOnReset set to true, we will not include the -S flag in the adb shell am start call. With this capability omitted or set to false, we include the -S flag. Default false

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.UnicodeKeyboard
member.summary: Enable Unicode input, default false

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.ResetKeyboard
member.summary: Reset keyboard to its original state, after running Unicode tests with unicodeKeyboard capability. Ignored if used alone. Default false

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.NoSign
member.summary: Skip checking and signing of app with debug keys, will work only with UiAutomator and not with selendroid, default false

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.IgnoreUnimportantViews
member.summary: Calls the setCompressedLayoutHierarchy() uiautomator function. This capability can speed up test execution, since Accessibility commands will run faster ignoring some elements. The ignored elements will not be findable, which is why this capability has also been implemented as a toggle-able setting as well as a capability. Defaults to false

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.DisableAndroidWatchers
member.summary: Disables android watchers that watch for application not responding and application crash, this will reduce cpu usage on android device/emulator. This capability will work only with UiAutomator and not with selendroid, default false

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.ChromeOptions
member.summary: Allows passing chromeOptions capability for ChromeDriver. For more information see chromeOptions: https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/capabilities

members.member: Kill ChromeDriver session when moving to a non-ChromeDriver webview. Defaults to false

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.NativeWebScreenshot
member.summary: In a web context, use native (adb) method for taking a screenshot, rather than proxying to ChromeDriver, default false.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.AndroidScreenshotPath
member.summary: The name of the directory on the device in which the screenshot will be put. Defaults to /data/local/tmp.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.AndroidInstallTimeout
member.summary: Timeout in milliseconds used to wait for an apk to install to the device. Defaults to `90000`.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.AppWaitDuration
member.summary: Timeout in seconds while waiting for device to become ready.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.AndroidMobileCapabilityType.AutoGrantPermissions
member.summary: Have Appium automatically determine which permissions your app requires and grant them to the app on install. Defaults to false. If noReset is true, this capability doesn't work.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType
member.summary: The list of iOS-specific capabilities Read: https://github.com/appium/appium/blob/1.5/docs/en/writing-running-appium/caps.md#ios-only

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.CalendarFormat
member.summary: (Sim-only) Calendar format to set for the iOS Simulator

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.BundleId
member.summary: Bundle ID of the app under test. Useful for starting an app on a real device or for using other caps which require the bundle ID during test startup. To run a test on a real device using the bundle ID, you may omit the 'app' capability, but you must provide 'udid'.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.LaunchTimeout
member.summary: Amount of time in ms to wait for instruments before assuming it hung and failing the session

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.LocationServicesEnabled
member.summary: (Sim-only) Force location services to be either on or off. Default is to keep current sim setting.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.LocationServicesAuthorized
member.summary: (Sim-only) Set location services to be authorized or not authorized for app via plist, so that location services alert doesn't pop up. Default is to keep current sim setting. Note that if you use this setting you MUST also use the bundleId capability to send in your app's bundle ID.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.AutoAcceptAlerts
member.summary: Accept all iOS alerts automatically if they pop up. This includes privacy access permission alerts (e.g., location, contacts, photos). Default is false.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.AutoDismissAlerts
member.summary: Dismiss all iOS alerts automatically if they pop up. This includes privacy access permission alerts (e.g., location, contacts, photos). Default is false.

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.NativeInstrumentsLib
member.summary: Use native intruments lib (ie disable instruments-without-delay).

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.NativeWebTap
member.summary: (Sim-only) Enable "real", non-javascript-based web taps in Safari. Default: false. Warning: depending on viewport size/ratio this might not accurately tap an element

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.SafariInitialUrl
member.summary: (Sim-only) (>= 8.1) Initial safari url, default is a local welcome page

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.SafariAllowPopups

member.name: F:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Enums.IOSMobileCapabilityType.SafariOpenLinksInBackground

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.ComparisonOptions.Visualize
member.summary: Makes the endpoint to return an image, which contains the visualized result of the corresponding picture matching operation. This option is disabled by default.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.ComparisonResult.Visualization
member.summary: The visualization of the matching result represented as base64-encoded PNG image.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.FeaturesMatchingOptions.DetectorName
member.summary: Sets the detector name for features matching algorithm. Some of these detectors (FAST, AGAST, GFTT, FAST, SIFT and MSER) are not available in the default OpenCV installation and have to be enabled manually before library compilation. The default detector name is 'ORB'.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.FeaturesMatchingOptions.MatchFunc
member.summary: The name of the matching function. The default one is 'BruteForce'.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.FeaturesMatchingOptions.GoodMatchesFactor
member.summary: The maximum count of "good" matches (e. g. with minimal distances).

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.FeaturesMatchingResult.Count
member.summary: The count of matched edges on both images. The more matching edges there are no both images the more similar they are.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.FeaturesMatchingResult.TotalCount
member.summary: The total count of matched edges on both images. It is equal to `count` if `goodMatchesFactor` does not limit the matches, otherwise it contains the total count of matches before `goodMatchesFactor` is applied.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.FeaturesMatchingResult.Points1
member.summary: The list of matching points on the first image.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.FeaturesMatchingResult.Points2
member.summary: The list of matching points on the second image.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.FeaturesMatchingResult.Rect1
member.summary: The bounding rect for the `points1` list or a zero rect if not enough matching points were found.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.FeaturesMatchingResult.Rect2
member.summary: The bounding rect for the `points2` list or a zero rect if not enough matching points were found.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.OccurenceMatchingOptions.Threshold
member.summary: At what normalized threshold to reject an occurrence. Value in range 0..1. 0.5 is the default value.

member.name: P:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ImageComparison.OccurenceMatchingResult.Rect
member.summary: The region of the partial image occurence on the full image.

member.name: T:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.Interfaces.IWebElementCached
member.summary: This interface extends IWebElement and adds caching support. To enable caching at the driver level, set the shouldUseCompactResponses capability: shouldUseCompactResponses: true To specify the attributes to be cached, set the elementResponseAttributes capability: elementResponseAttributes: "name,text,rect,attribute/name,attribute/value" Note: the cache uses W3C names for attributes. For TagName, use "name" For Size, Location use "rect"

member.summary: The video encoding quality (low, medium, high, photo - defaults to medium). Only works for real devices.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.iOS.IOSStartScreenRecordingOptions.WithTimeLimit(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: The maximum recording time.The default value is 180 seconds (3 minutes). The maximum value is 10 minutes. Setting values greater than this or less than zero will cause an exception. The minimum time resolution unit is one second.
member.param: The actual time limit of the recorded video.
member.returns: self instance for chaining.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.iOS.IOSStartScreenRecordingOptions.WithVideoFps(System.String)
member.summary: The Frames Per Second rate of the recorded video. Change this value if the resulting video is too slow or too fast. Defaults to 10. This can decrease the resulting file size.
member.returns: self instance for chaining.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.iOS.IOSStartScreenRecordingOptions.WithVideoScale(System.String)
member.summary: The scaling value to apply. Read here for possible values. Example value of 720p scaling is '1280:720'. This can decrease/increase the resulting file size. No scale is applied by default.
member.returns: self instance for chaining.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.iOS.IOSStartScreenRecordingOptions.WithPixelFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Output pixel format. Run ffmpeg -pix_fmts to list possible values. For QuickTime compatibility, set to yuv420p along with videoType: libx264. Supported since Appium 1.12.0)

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.iOS.IOSStartScreenRecordingOptions.WithVideoFilter(System.String)

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.PageObjects.Attributes.Abstract.FindsByMobileAttribute.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns:
A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings:
ValueMeaning
Less than zeroThis instance precedes in the sort order.
ZeroThis instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as .
Greater than zeroThis instance follows in the sort order.

member.name: M:OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ScreenRecording.BaseStartScreenRecordingOptions`1.WithUploadOptions(OpenQA.Selenium.Appium.ScreenRecording.ScreenRecordingUploadOptions)
member.summary:
The remotePath upload option is the path to the remote location, where the resulting video should be uploaded. The following protocols are supported: http/https (multipart), ftp.
Missing value (the default setting) means the content of the resulting file should be encoded as Base64 and passed as the endpoint response value, but an exception will be thrown if the generated media file is too big to fit into the available process memory. This option only has an effect if there is a screen recording session in progress and forced restart is not enabled (the default setting).
member.param: Upload options
member.returns: self instance for chaining.

This option causes Appium to delete all devices other than the one being used by Appium. Note that this is a permanent deletion, and you are responsible for using simctl or xcode to manage the categories of devices used with Appium
.
